content.question: For a certain population of penguins, the distribution of weight is approximately normal with mean <math alttext="15.1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>15.1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> kilograms (<math alttext="k g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>kg</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) and standard deviation <math alttext="2.2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2.2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Approximately what percent of the penguins from the population have a weight between <math alttext="13.0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>13.0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="16.5" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>16.5</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> <math alttext="kilograms" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mi>k</mi><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>?

skill.text: Skill 3.A: Determine relative frequencies, proportions, or probabilities using simulation or calculations.
